clusters.title: Macron scouts for new prime minister to quell turmoil
clusters.neutral_headline: French President Seeks New Prime Minister Amid Political Turmoil

items.title: Macron scouts for new prime minister to quell turmoil
items.standfirst: French president has no easy fixes after another government falls and could turn to a loyalist
items.content: French president has no easy fixes after another government falls and could turn to a loyalist

items.title: Live: Macron on lookout for new PM as Bayrou set to hand in resignation
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron is on Tuesday expected to accept the resignation of his Prime Minister François Bayrou after the latter lost a confidence vote he had himself called over his austerity budget. Following the defeat in parliament Monday, Macron said he would name a new prime minister “in the next few days”. Follow our liveblog for all the latest developments.
items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron is on Tuesday expected to accept the resignation of his Prime Minister François Bayrou after the latter lost a confidence vote he had himself called over his austerity budget. Following the defeat in parliament Monday, Macron said he would name a new prime minister “in the next few days”. Follow our liveblog for all the latest developments.

items.title: Macron scouts for new prime minister to quell turmoil
items.standfirst: French president has no easy fixes after another government falls and could turn to a loyalist
items.content: French president has no easy fixes after another government falls and could turn to a loyalist

items.title: Why France’s political crisis isn’t (yet) an economic one
items.standfirst: Based on factual reporting, although it Incorporates the expertise of the author/producer and may offer interpretations and conclusions. France, many claim, is on the brink of economic collapse. Just ask its own government. Prime Minister François Bayrou – who is set to resign after losing…

France, many claim, is on the brink of economic collapse. Just ask its own government. Prime Minister François Bayrou – who is set to resign after losing…

items.title: François Bayrou ousted as French PM after confidence gamble backfires
items.standfirst: Prime Minister François Bayrou’s nine-month tenure ended in political collapse Monday, after lawmakers ousted the veteran centrist in a crushing defeat. Once seen as President Emmanuel Macron’s best hope to steady a fractured government, Bayrou saw his push for sweeping austerity and a high-risk confidence gamble backfire – leaving Macron searching for yet another successor.
items.content: Prime Minister François Bayrou’s nine-month tenure ended in political collapse Monday, after lawmakers ousted the veteran centrist in a crushing defeat. Once seen as President Emmanuel Macron’s best hope to steady a fractured government, Bayrou saw his push for sweeping austerity and a high-risk confidence gamble backfire – leaving Macron searching for yet another successor.

items.title: Macron to seek yet another PM after French lawmakers oust Bayrou government
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron is expected to appoint a new prime minister "within days" after lawmakers ousted François Bayrou in a no-confidence vote Monday, marking the collapse of France’s third government since snap elections last year. The political upheaval leaves Macron scrambling to restore stability amid mounting national debt, a fractured parliament, and growing public discontent.
items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron is expected to appoint a new prime minister "within days" after lawmakers ousted François Bayrou in a no-confidence vote Monday, marking the collapse of France’s third government since snap elections last year. The political upheaval leaves Macron scrambling to restore stability amid mounting national debt, a fractured parliament, and growing public discontent.

items.title: French MPs ‘relieved’ and ‘worried’ after confidence vote topples PM Bayrou
items.standfirst: French MPs are both "relieved" and "worried" to see Prime Minister François Bayrou go after a confidence vote toppled the government on Monday, FRANCE 24 French politics editor Marc Perelman said. While French lawmakers overwhelmingly voted to oust Bayrou and his cabinet, many are concerned that France is becoming increasingly unstable politically, Perelman said.
items.content: French MPs are both "relieved" and "worried" to see Prime Minister François Bayrou go after a confidence vote toppled the government on Monday, FRANCE 24 French politics editor Marc Perelman said. While French lawmakers overwhelmingly voted to oust Bayrou and his cabinet, many are concerned that France is becoming increasingly unstable politically, Perelman said.

items.title: French govt toppled in confidence vote: Macron seen as 'lame duck' on European stage
items.standfirst: It's the second time the French government has fallen since the 2024 snap legislative elections called by President Emmanuel Macron, and there is no end in sight to the country's political instability, FRANCE 24 Brussels correspondent Dave Keating said. Prime Minister François Bayrou's defeat in Monday's confidence vote "adds to the perception that President Macron is a lame duck and unable to take a lead on the European stage", Keating said.
items.content: It's the second time the French government has fallen since the 2024 snap legislative elections called by President Emmanuel Macron, and there is no end in sight to the country's political instability, FRANCE 24 Brussels correspondent Dave Keating said. Prime Minister François Bayrou's defeat in Monday's confidence vote "adds to the perception that President Macron is a lame duck and unable to take a lead on the European stage", Keating said.

items.title: France in fresh political crisis after MPs oust prime minister
items.standfirst: The French government loses a vote of confidence and PM François Bayrou will resign on Tuesday.
items.content: The French government loses a vote of confidence and PM François Bayrou will resign on Tuesday.

items.title: French government collapses as prime minister is ousted
items.standfirst: French President Emmanuel Macron must search for a fourth prime minister in 12 months after Prime Minister François Bayrou was ousted.
items.content: French President Emmanuel Macron must search for a fourth prime minister in 12 months after Prime Minister François Bayrou was ousted.

items.title: François Bayrou ousted as French PM after losing confidence vote
items.standfirst: Government collapses after Emmanuel Macron’s ally wins support of just 194 MPs with 364 against François Bayrou has been ousted in a confidence vote after only nine months as prime minister, collapsing his minority government and plunging France into a political crisis.Bayrou, 74, will hand his resignation to Emmanuel Macron, his longterm centrist ally, on Tuesday morning. Continue reading...
items.content: Government collapses after Emmanuel Macron’s ally wins support of just 194 MPs with 364 against François Bayrou has been ousted in a confidence vote after only nine months as prime minister, collapsing his minority government and plunging France into a political crisis.Bayrou, 74, will hand his resignation to Emmanuel Macron, his longterm centrist ally, on Tuesday morning. Continue reading...

items.title: French PM Bayrou loses confidence vote
items.standfirst: France’s parliament voted to topple the government of Prime Minister François Bayrou on Monday after the PM surprised even his own allies by calling a confidence vote to resolve a months-long deadlock over his austerity budget. Bayrou will tender his resignation on Tuesday morning, plunging France into fresh political turmoil.
items.content: France’s parliament voted to topple the government of Prime Minister François Bayrou on Monday after the PM surprised even his own allies by calling a confidence vote to resolve a months-long deadlock over his austerity budget. Bayrou will tender his resignation on Tuesday morning, plunging France into fresh political turmoil.

items.title: Who will Macron appoint as next PM after Bayrou ousted?
items.standfirst: Legislators toppled France’s government in a confidence vote on Monday, a new crisis for Europe’s second-largest economy that obliges President Emmanuel Macron to search for a fourth prime minister in 12 months. But who that replacement will be remains unclear. France 24's Clovis Casali discusses what Macron might do next with Green Party MP Nicolas Bonnet.
items.content: Legislators toppled France’s government in a confidence vote on Monday, a new crisis for Europe’s second-largest economy that obliges President Emmanuel Macron to search for a fourth prime minister in 12 months. But who that replacement will be remains unclear. France 24's Clovis Casali discusses what Macron might do next with Green Party MP Nicolas Bonnet.

items.title: 'A victory for the French people' as Bayrou's government toppled
items.standfirst: Claire Lejeune, a French MP and member of the far-left France Unbowed, tells France 24's Clovis Casali that the toppling of prime minister François Bayrou's government in a confidence vote Monday was a "victory for the French people" as his government had "no democratic legitimacy".
items.content: Claire Lejeune, a French MP and member of the far-left France Unbowed, tells France 24's Clovis Casali that the toppling of prime minister François Bayrou's government in a confidence vote Monday was a "victory for the French people" as his government had "no democratic legitimacy".

items.title: France: PM Bayrou government toppled in confidence vote
items.standfirst: French lawmakers have voted to topple PM François #Bayrou after just nine months in office. He’s the 5th prime minister since 2022. #France now faces fresh #political turmoil.
items.content: French lawmakers have voted to topple PM François #Bayrou after just nine months in office. He’s the 5th prime minister since 2022. #France now faces fresh #political turmoil.

items.title: France's government collapses after the prime minister loses a confidence vote
items.standfirst: Legislators toppled France's government in a confidence vote, a new crisis for Europe's second-largest economy. Prime Minister François Bayrou was ousted overwhelmingly in a 364-194 vote against him.
items.content: Legislators toppled France's government in a confidence vote, a new crisis for Europe's second-largest economy. Prime Minister François Bayrou was ousted overwhelmingly in a 364-194 vote against him.(Image credit: Christophe Ena)

items.title: Why has the French PM had to go and what happens next?
items.standfirst: France's prime minister has lost a confidence vote, sending parliament into another period of chaos and uncertainty.
items.content: France's prime minister has lost a confidence vote, sending parliament into another period of chaos and uncertainty.

items.title: French PM Bayrou's government toppled in confidence vote
items.standfirst: France's parliament voted on Monday to bring down the government over its plans to tame the ballooning national debt, deepening a political crisis and handing President Emmanuel Macron the task of finding a fifth prime minister in less than two years.
items.content: France's parliament voted on Monday to bring down the government over its plans to tame the ballooning national debt, deepening a political crisis and handing President Emmanuel Macron the task of finding a fifth prime minister in less than two years.

items.title: France's ruling government collapses in major blow to President Emmanuel Macron
items.standfirst: France's National Assembly is set to vote for a motion of no confidence in François Bayrou, less than a year after they did the same for Michel Barnier.
items.content: France's National Assembly is set to vote for a motion of no confidence in François Bayrou, less than a year after they did the same for Michel Barnier.

items.title: French PM loses confidence vote - as country's political crisis deepens
items.standfirst: France's prime minister has failed in a last-minute bid to save his job, with the country's National Assembly ousting him in a confidence vote.
items.content: France's prime minister has failed in a last-minute bid to save his job, with the country's National Assembly ousting him in a confidence vote.

ai_summary: French President Macron will appoint a new prime minister in the coming days.
The current Prime Minister, François Bayrou, resigned after a confidence vote loss.
This marks the third government collapse since snap elections last year.
The political crisis is not yet considered an economic one by many sources.
Macron is seeking a successor to stabilize the fractured government.

items.title: Murdoch heirs settle dispute over control of the right-wing mogul's media empire
items.standfirst: Rupert Murdoch’s children reached a settlement in their legal battle over control of the media empire, his companies said Monday, cementing eldest son Lachlan’s leadership. The deal ends litigation from siblings who contested Murdoch’s push to install Lachlan, who shares his father’s right-wing political orientation, as successor.
items.content: Rupert Murdoch’s children reached a settlement in their legal battle over control of the media empire, his companies said Monday, cementing eldest son Lachlan’s leadership. The deal ends litigation from siblings who contested Murdoch’s push to install Lachlan, who shares his father’s right-wing political orientation, as successor.

items.title: Succession secured: Murdoch family reach deal over future of media empire
items.standfirst: The Murdoch family have reached a deal which will see Rupert Murdoch's son Lachlan cement control of the family media empire that includes Fox News and The Wall Street Journal.
items.content: The Murdoch family have reached a deal which will see Rupert Murdoch's son Lachlan cement control of the family media empire that includes Fox News and The Wall Street Journal.

Murdoch Family Succession Ends Drama, Confirms Lachlan’s Leadership

The agreement ensures the conservative network, a key platform for President Donald Trump and his allies, will not change course after Murdoch’s passing. Lachlan,…

The agreement ensures the conservative network, a key platform for President Donald Trump and his allies, will not change course after Murdoch’s passing. Lachlan,…

items.title: Murdoch family reaches deal to resolve succession fight over media empire
items.standfirst: Family announces Rupert Murdoch’s eldest son, Lachlan Murdoch, will secure control of businessThe succession battle at Rupert Murdoch’s media empire has ended.The family announced on Monday that Lachlan Murdoch, Murdoch’s eldest son, will secure control of the Murdochs’ sprawling media empire that includes Fox News, The Wall Street Journal and The Times in the UK, with his three oldest siblings receiving an estimated $1.1bn each for their shares in the business. Continue reading...
items.content: Family announces Rupert Murdoch’s eldest son, Lachlan Murdoch, will secure control of businessThe succession battle at Rupert Murdoch’s media empire has ended.The family announced on Monday that Lachlan Murdoch, Murdoch’s eldest son, will secure control of the Murdochs’ sprawling media empire that includes Fox News, The Wall Street Journal and The Times in the UK, with his three oldest siblings receiving an estimated $1.1bn each for their shares in the business. Continue reading...

items.content: Lachlan takes control as three siblings receive $1.1bn each to settle long-running family feud

items.title: Rupert Murdoch buys out 3 of his children to seal fate of his media empire
items.standfirst: The owner of Fox News, the Wall Street Journal and dozens of other media properties has settled a legal fight with three of his own children over who would control his companies after his death.
items.content: The owner of Fox News, the Wall Street Journal and dozens of other media properties has settled a legal fight with three of his own children over who would control his companies after his death.(Image credit: Anna Moneymaker/Getty Images)

ai_summary: Lachlan Murdoch will retain control of the Fox and News Corp media empire.
The deal resolves a succession battle among Rupert Murdoch's children.
The settlement ends litigation over Lachlan's leadership of the companies.
The Murdoch family's media empire includes Fox News and The Wall Street Journal.
Lachlan Murdoch's leadership is now secured after the deal.

items.title: Nepal lifts social media ban following protests where police killed 19 people
items.standfirst: Nepal's government lifted its ban on social media platforms Tuesday a day after police killed opened fire on mass street protests against the ban, killing 19 people.
items.content: Nepal's government lifted its ban on social media platforms Tuesday a day after police killed opened fire on mass street protests against the ban, killing 19 people.(Image credit: Niranjan Shrestha)

items.content: Nepal's government on Tuesday lifted the ban it imposed last week on social media platforms, after street protests resulted in the death of 19 people on Monday. The country's Minister for Com...

items.title: Nepal rolls back social media ban after deadly protests rock capital
items.standfirst: Thousands joined the ‘Gen Z’ demonstrations, which protesters said reflected their frustration with the ban and anger over alleged corrupt officialsNepal’s government has lifted its ban on 26 prominent social media apps and messaging services after at least 19 people were killed and more than 200 injured in clashes on Monday.The country’s communication and information minister announced the ban would be rolled back hours after demonstrators protesting against the block surged towards the parliament complex in the capital, Kathmandu. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

The ban, which blocked access to 26 platforms including Facebook, Instagram, YouTube, and X, was imposed following…

items.title: Protests in Nepal over social media ban turn deadly
items.standfirst: At least 19 people were killed as protests broke out over a government attempt to regulate social media that blocked some of the world’s largest platforms.
items.content: At least 19 people were killed as protests broke out over a government attempt to regulate social media that blocked some of the world’s largest platforms.

items.title: Nepal lifts social media ban after deadly protests
items.standfirst: Nepal has lifted a ban on social media platforms including Facebook and YouTube after protests that led to 19 people being killed.
items.content: Nepal has lifted a ban on social media platforms including Facebook and YouTube after protests that led to 19 people being killed.

items.title: Nepal lifts social media ban after 19 killed in protests against corruption
items.standfirst: Nepal's Communications and Information Technology Minister Prithvi Subba Gurung says the ban is 'withdrawn'.
items.content: Nepal's Communications and Information Technology Minister Prithvi Subba Gurung says the ban is 'withdrawn'.

items.title: At least 19 killed in ‘gen Z’ protests against Nepal’s social media ban
items.standfirst: Many demonstrators say they are also on the streets over corruption and nepotism they allege is rampant At least 19 people have been killed during protests in Nepal over a government ban on dozens of online platforms including Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp and X.The government has faced mounting criticism after imposing a ban on 26 prominent social media platforms and messaging apps last week because they had missed a deadline to register under new regulations. Continue reading...
items.content: Many demonstrators say they are also on the streets over corruption and nepotism they allege is rampant At least 19 people have been killed during protests in Nepal over a government ban on dozens of online platforms including Facebook, Instagram, WhatsApp and X.The government has faced mounting criticism after imposing a ban on 26 prominent social media platforms and messaging apps last week because they had missed a deadline to register under new regulations. Continue reading...

items.title: Nepal Scraps Social-Media Ban After Clashes Kill 19 People
items.standfirst: Nepal’s government scrapped a days-old prohibition on social-media after the ban sparked deadly clashes between police and protesters that local media reported left 19 people dead and 347 injured.
items.content: Nepal’s government scrapped a days-old prohibition on social-media after the ban sparked deadly clashes between police and protesters that local media reported left 19 people dead and 347 injured.

ai_summary: Nepal's government lifted its social media ban on Tuesday.
The ban was imposed last week, triggering protests and violence.
Protests were led by Gen Z, fueled by corruption and censorship concerns.
Nineteen people died in clashes between protesters and police.
Over 200 people were injured during the protests.

items.content: The book containing 50th birthday tributes to Jeffrey Epstein was released on Monday by the House Oversight Committee.

items.content: The White House says the president did not draw the picture or sign the note, after it was published on Monday.

items.title: Democrats rekindle Trump’s Epstein problem with birthday note
items.standfirst: Message purporting to be from the president revives controversy over links to the late disgraced financier
items.content: Message purporting to be from the president revives controversy over links to the late disgraced financier

items.title: House committee releases image of apparent Trump birthday note and entire Epstein album
items.standfirst: Image mirrors report of letter, turned over by estate lawyers after subpoena and part of ‘infamous “Birthday Book”’Trump news at a glance: Epstein case haunts Trump as alleged birthday letter releasedHouse Democrats on Monday released an image of a sexually suggestive letter and drawing that appears to bear the signature of Donald Trump, the very same note the president had denied writing after reports of its existence were published earlier this year in the Wall Street Journal.The letter, which was turned over by lawyers for disgraced financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein’s estate in response to a subpoena from the House oversight committee, was included in a set of notes sent to the convicted sex offender for his 50th birthday. Continue reading...
items.content: Image mirrors report of letter, turned over by estate lawyers after subpoena and part of ‘infamous “Birthday Book”’Trump news at a glance: Epstein case haunts Trump as alleged birthday letter releasedHouse Democrats on Monday released an image of a sexually suggestive letter and drawing that appears to bear the signature of Donald Trump, the very same note the president had denied writing after reports of its existence were published earlier this year in the Wall Street Journal.The letter, which was turned over by lawyers for disgraced financier and sex offender Jeffrey Epstein’s estate in response to a subpoena from the House oversight committee, was included in a set of notes sent to the convicted sex offender for his 50th birthday. Continue reading...

items.title: House Democrats release birthday note to Epstein allegedly from Trump
items.standfirst: Democrats on the House Oversight Committee have released what they claim is a copy of a birthday note that President Trump sent to Jeffrey Epstein in 2003. The president has denied penning the message. Scott MacFarlane has details.
items.content: Democrats on the House Oversight Committee have released what they claim is a copy of a birthday note that President Trump sent to Jeffrey Epstein in 2003. The president has denied penning the message. Scott MacFarlane has details.

items.title: Details on alleged Trump message for Epstein, Trump's denial
items.standfirst: A birthday message allegedly written by President Trump to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein was released by Democrats on the House Oversight Committee on Monday. Mr. Trump has denied writing the message. CBS News legal reporter Katrina Kaufman has more.
items.content: A birthday message allegedly written by President Trump to convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein was released by Democrats on the House Oversight Committee on Monday. Mr. Trump has denied writing the message. CBS News legal reporter Katrina Kaufman has more.

items.title: House releases Trump's alleged birthday message to Jeffrey Epstein
items.standfirst: The Republican-led House Oversight Committee received materials Monday from convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein's estate, including a birthday book containing an explicit message allegedly from President Trump to Epstein. Mr. Trump has denied writing the message. Barry Levine, author of the book "The Spider: Inside the Criminal Web of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell," joined CBS News to discuss.
items.content: The Republican-led House Oversight Committee received materials Monday from convicted sex offender Jeffrey Epstein's estate, including a birthday book containing an explicit message allegedly from President Trump to Epstein. Mr. Trump has denied writing the message. Barry Levine, author of the book "The Spider: Inside the Criminal Web of Jeffrey Epstein and Ghislaine Maxwell," joined CBS News to discuss.

items.title: Estate of Jeffrey Epstein gives Congress 'birthday book' allegedly signed by Trump
items.standfirst: Democrats on the House Oversight Committee said the book included a tawdry drawing and note that appeared to include President Trump's signature. Trump had previously denied its existence.
items.content: Democrats on the House Oversight Committee said the book included a tawdry drawing and note that appeared to include President Trump's signature. Trump had previously denied its existence. (Image credit: Kevin Dietsch)

items.title: Trump’s alleged, suggestive birthday note to Epstein released by Democrats
items.standfirst: After the letter was first reported by the WSJ, Trump denied he had written such a note and later sued for $10bn.
items.content: After the letter was first reported by the WSJ, Trump denied he had written such a note and later sued for $10bn.

ai_summary: A House committee released an image of an alleged Trump birthday note to Epstein.
The note is part of Epstein's "Birthday Book" released by the House Oversight Committee.
President Trump has denied writing or signing the message.
The album release revives controversy over Trump's links to Epstein.
The committee also released the entire Epstein birthday album image.

items.title: 9/8: CBS Evening News Plus
items.standfirst: Palestinian gunmen kill 6 people in attack at Jerusalem bus stop; Reporter's Notebook: The risks of believing Putin's promises

items.title: Six Israelis killed in terror attack at bus stop
items.standfirst: Six Israelis were killed when police said two Palestinian gunmen opened fire on people at a bus stop in Jerusalem. The gunmen were later killed. NBC News’ Richard Engel reports.
items.content: Six Israelis were killed when police said two Palestinian gunmen opened fire on people at a bus stop in Jerusalem. The gunmen were later killed. NBC News’ Richard Engel reports.

items.title: Palestinian gunmen kill 6 in Jerusalem as U.S. offers new Gaza ceasefire proposal
items.standfirst: Hamas praised a Palestinian shooting attack that killed six Israelis at a bus stop in Jerusalem. The U.S. presented a new truce proposal and Israel stepped up Gaza City attacks.
items.content: Hamas praised a Palestinian shooting attack that killed six Israelis at a bus stop in Jerusalem. The U.S. presented a new truce proposal and Israel stepped up Gaza City attacks.

items.title: Palestinian gunmen kill six people at Jerusalem bus stop
items.standfirst: At least 12 others injured in attack at Ramot intersection during morning rush hourPalestinian gunmen opened fire at a crowded bus stop in the northern outskirts of Jerusalem on Monday, killing six people and injuring 12 others before being shot dead by an off-duty soldier and a civilian at the scene.The victims included a 79-year-old former cardiologist, a 43-year-old rabbi and a 25-year-old who had recently emigrated from Spain. Twenty-six others suffered injuries, including six who were left in a serious condition with gunshot wounds. Continue reading...

items.title: Norway's Labour PM wins legislative elections, holds off populist surge
items.standfirst: Norway’s Labour Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Store declared victory in Monday’s legislative elections, fending off a challenge from the populist right. The anti-immigration Progress Party secured its strongest showing on record, reflecting a broader shift in the political landscape but falling short of overtaking Store’s Labour-led coalition.
items.content: Norway’s Labour Prime Minister Jonas Gahr Store declared victory in Monday’s legislative elections, fending off a challenge from the populist right. The anti-immigration Progress Party secured its strongest showing on record, reflecting a broader shift in the political landscape but falling short of overtaking Store’s Labour-led coalition.

items.title: Norway’s Labour party wins election after seeing off populist surge
items.standfirst: Success for party of the prime minister, Jonas Gahr Støre, despite increased support for rightwing Progress partyThe Norwegian Labour party has secured four more years in government after seeing off a surge of support for the populist right in a polarised election.Soon after the polls closed, the centre left was projected to win with 89 seats with the centre right taking 80 seats. A minimum of 85 seats are needed for a majority. Continue reading...
items.content: Success for party of the prime minister, Jonas Gahr Støre, despite increased support for rightwing Progress partyThe Norwegian Labour party has secured four more years in government after seeing off a surge of support for the populist right in a polarised election.Soon after the polls closed, the centre left was projected to win with 89 seats with the centre right taking 80 seats. A minimum of 85 seats are needed for a majority. Continue reading...
